functions.docstring:
"""
    Decorator for filters which should only receive strings. The object
    passed as the first positional argument will be converted to a string.
    """
functions.name: stringfilter

functions.docstring:
"""
    Add slashes before quotes. Useful for escaping strings in CSV, for
    example. Less useful for escaping JavaScript; use the ``escapejs``
    filter instead.
    """
functions.name: addslashes

functions.docstring: """Capitalize the first character of the value."""
functions.name: capfirst

functions.docstring: """Hex encode characters for use in JavaScript strings."""
functions.name: escapejs_filter

functions.docstring:
"""
    Output value JSON-encoded, wrapped in a <script type="application/json">
    tag.
    """
functions.name: json_script

functions.docstring:
"""
    Display a float to a specified number of decimal places.

    If called without an argument, display the floating point number with one
    decimal place -- but only if there's a decimal place to be displayed:

    * num1 = 34.23234
    * num2 = 34.00000
    * num3 = 34.26000
    * {{ num1|floatformat }} displays "34.2"
    * {{ num2|floatformat }} displays "34"
    * {{ num3|floatformat }} displays "34.3"

    If arg is positive, always display exactly arg number of decimal places:

    * {{ num1|floatformat:3 }} displays "34.232"
    * {{ num2|floatformat:3 }} displays "34.000"
    * {{ num3|floatformat:3 }} displays "34.260"

    If arg is negative, display arg number of decimal places -- but only if
    there are places to be displayed:

    * {{ num1|floatformat:"-3" }} displays "34.232"
    * {{ num2|floatformat:"-3" }} displays "34"
    * {{ num3|floatformat:"-3" }} displays "34.260"

    If arg has the 'g' suffix, force the result to be grouped by the
    THOUSAND_SEPARATOR for the active locale. When the active locale is
    en (English):

    * {{ 6666.6666|floatformat:"2g" }} displays "6,666.67"
    * {{ 10000|floatformat:"g" }} displays "10,000"

    If arg has the 'u' suffix, force the result to be unlocalized. When the
    active locale is pl (Polish):

    * {{ 66666.6666|floatformat:"2" }} displays "66666,67"
    * {{ 66666.6666|floatformat:"2u" }} displays "66666.67"

    If the input float is infinity or NaN, display the string representation
    of that value.
    """
functions.name: floatformat

functions.docstring: """Escape an IRI value for use in a URL."""
functions.name: iriencode

functions.docstring: """Display text with line numbers."""
functions.name: linenumbers

functions.docstring: """Convert a string into all lowercase."""
functions.name: lower

functions.docstring:
"""
    Return the value turned into a list.

    For an integer, it's a list of digits.
    For a string, it's a list of characters.
    """
functions.name: make_list

functions.docstring:
"""
    Convert to ASCII. Convert spaces to hyphens. Remove characters that aren't
    alphanumerics, underscores, or hyphens. Convert to lowercase. Also strip
    leading and trailing whitespace.
    """
functions.name: slugify

functions.docstring:
"""
    Format the variable according to the arg, a string formatting specifier.

    This specifier uses Python string formatting syntax, with the exception
    that the leading "%" is dropped.

    See https://docs.python.org/library/stdtypes.html#printf-style-string-formatting
    for documentation of Python string formatting.
    """
functions.name: stringformat

functions.docstring: """Convert a string into titlecase."""
functions.name: title

functions.docstring: """Truncate a string after `arg` number of characters."""
functions.name: truncatechars

functions.docstring:
"""
    Truncate HTML after `arg` number of chars.
    Preserve newlines in the HTML.
    """
functions.name: truncatechars_html

functions.docstring:
"""
    Truncate a string after `arg` number of words.
    Remove newlines within the string.
    """
functions.name: truncatewords

functions.docstring:
"""
    Truncate HTML after `arg` number of words.
    Preserve newlines in the HTML.
    """
functions.name: truncatewords_html

functions.docstring: """Convert a string into all uppercase."""
functions.name: upper

functions.docstring:
"""
    Escape a value for use in a URL.

    The ``safe`` parameter determines the characters which should not be
    escaped by Python's quote() function. If not provided, use the default safe
    characters (but an empty string can be provided when *all* characters
    should be escaped).
    """
functions.name: urlencode

functions.docstring: """Convert URLs in plain text into clickable links."""
functions.name: urlize

functions.docstring:
"""
    Convert URLs into clickable links, truncating URLs to the given character
    limit, and adding 'rel=nofollow' attribute to discourage spamming.

    Argument: Length to truncate URLs to.
    """
functions.name: urlizetrunc

functions.docstring: """Return the number of words."""
functions.name: wordcount

functions.docstring: """Wrap words at `arg` line length."""
functions.name: wordwrap

functions.docstring: """Left-align the value in a field of a given width."""
functions.name: ljust

functions.docstring: """Right-align the value in a field of a given width."""
functions.name: rjust

functions.docstring: """Center the value in a field of a given width."""
functions.name: center

functions.docstring: """Remove all values of arg from the given string."""
functions.name: cut

functions.docstring: """Mark the value as a string that should be auto-escaped."""
functions.name: escape_filter

functions.docstring:
"""
    Escape a string's HTML. Return a new string containing the escaped
    characters (as opposed to "escape", which marks the content for later
    possible escaping).
    """
functions.name: force_escape

functions.docstring:
""" Replace line breaks in plain text with appropriate HTML; a single newline becomes an HTML line break (``
``) and a new line followed by a blank line becomes a paragraph break (``

``). """
functions.name: linebreaks_filter

functions.docstring:
""" Convert all newlines in a piece of plain text to HTML line breaks (``
``). """
functions.name: linebreaksbr

functions.docstring: """Mark the value as a string that should not be auto-escaped."""
functions.name: safe

functions.docstring:
"""
    A "safe" filter for sequences. Mark each element in the sequence,
    individually, as safe, after converting them to strings. Return a list
    with the results.
    """
functions.name: safeseq

functions.docstring: """Strip all [X]HTML tags."""
functions.name: striptags

functions.docstring:
"""
    When arg is convertible to float, behave like operator.itemgetter(arg)
    Otherwise, behave like Variable(arg).resolve

    >>> _property_resolver(1)('abc')
    'b'
    >>> _property_resolver('1')('abc')
    Traceback (most recent call last):
    ...
    TypeError: string indices must be integers
    >>> class Foo:
    ...     a = 42
    ...     b = 3.14
    ...     c = 'Hey!'
    >>> _property_resolver('b')(Foo())
    3.14
    """
functions.name: _property_resolver

functions.docstring:
"""
    Given a list of dicts, return that list sorted by the property given in
    the argument.
    """
functions.name: dictsort

functions.docstring:
"""
    Given a list of dicts, return that list sorted in reverse order by the
    property given in the argument.
    """
functions.name: dictsortreversed

functions.docstring: """Return the first item in a list."""
functions.name: first

functions.docstring: """Join a list with a string, like Python's ``str.join(list)``."""
functions.name: join

functions.docstring: """Return the last item in a list."""
functions.name: last

functions.docstring: """Return the length of the value - useful for lists."""
functions.name: length

functions.docstring: """Return a boolean of whether the value's length is the argument."""
functions.name: length_is

functions.docstring: """Return a random item from the list."""
functions.name: random

functions.docstring:
"""
    Return a slice of the list using the same syntax as Python's list slicing.
    """
functions.name: slice_filter

functions.docstring:
""" Recursively take a self-nested list and return an HTML unordered list -- WITHOUT opening and closing
    tags. Assume the list is in the proper format. For example, if ``var`` contains: ``['States', ['Kansas', ['Lawrence', 'Topeka'], 'Illinois']]``, then ``{{ var|unordered_list }}`` returns::
  • States
    • Kansas
      • Lawrence
      • Topeka
    • Illinois
    • """
functions.name: unordered_list

functions.docstring: """Add the arg to the value."""
functions.name: add

functions.docstring:
"""
    Given a whole number, return the requested digit of it, where 1 is the
    right-most digit, 2 is the second-right-most digit, etc. Return the
    original value for invalid input (if input or argument is not an integer,
    or if argument is less than 1). Otherwise, output is always an integer.
    """
functions.name: get_digit

functions.docstring: """Format a date according to the given format."""
functions.name: date

functions.docstring: """Format a time according to the given format."""
functions.name: time

functions.docstring: """Format a date as the time since that date (i.e. "4 days, 6 hours")."""
functions.name: timesince_filter

functions.docstring: """Format a date as the time until that date (i.e. "4 days, 6 hours")."""
functions.name: timeuntil_filter

functions.docstring: """If value is unavailable, use given default."""
functions.name: default

functions.docstring: """If value is None, use given default."""
functions.name: default_if_none

functions.docstring: """Return True if the value is divisible by the argument."""
functions.name: divisibleby

functions.docstring:
"""
    Given a string mapping values for true, false, and (optionally) None,
    return one of those strings according to the value:

    ==========  ======================  ==================================
    Value       Argument                Outputs
    ==========  ======================  ==================================
    ``True``    ``"yeah,no,maybe"``     ``yeah``
    ``False``   ``"yeah,no,maybe"``     ``no``
    ``None``    ``"yeah,no,maybe"``     ``maybe``
    ``None``    ``"yeah,no"``           ``"no"`` (converts None to False
                                        if no mapping for None is given.
    ==========  ======================  ==================================
    """
functions.name: yesno

functions.docstring:
"""
    Format the value like a 'human-readable' file size (i.e. 13 KB, 4.1 MB,
    102 bytes, etc.).
    """
functions.name: filesizeformat

functions.docstring:
"""
    Return a plural suffix if the value is not 1, '1', or an object of
    length 1. By default, use 's' as the suffix:

    * If value is 0, vote{{ value|pluralize }} display "votes".
    * If value is 1, vote{{ value|pluralize }} display "vote".
    * If value is 2, vote{{ value|pluralize }} display "votes".

    If an argument is provided, use that string instead:

    * If value is 0, class{{ value|pluralize:"es" }} display "classes".
    * If value is 1, class{{ value|pluralize:"es" }} display "class".
    * If value is 2, class{{ value|pluralize:"es" }} display "classes".

    If the provided argument contains a comma, use the text before the comma
    for the singular case and the text after the comma for the plural case:

    * If value is 0, cand{{ value|pluralize:"y,ies" }} display "candies".
    * If value is 1, cand{{ value|pluralize:"y,ies" }} display "candy".
    * If value is 2, cand{{ value|pluralize:"y,ies" }} display "candies".
    """
functions.name: pluralize

functions.docstring: """Take a phone number and converts it in to its numerical equivalent."""
functions.name: phone2numeric_filter

functions.docstring: """A wrapper around pprint.pprint -- for debugging, really."""
functions.name: pprint
